name: World Geography Studies
subject: Social Studies
description: Examines people, places, and environments at local, regional, national, and international scales from spatial/ecological perspectives.

name: World Geography Studies (Advanced)
subject: Social Studies
description: Advanced examination of people, places, and environments at various scales from spatial/ecological perspectives.

name: World Geography Studies (TAG Advanced)
subject: Social Studies
description: Advanced examination for TAG students of people, places, and environments at various scales from spatial/ecological perspectives.

name: World Geography Studies, Applied
subject: Social Studies
description: Includes study of basic geographical terms, map skills, physical/human geography, global society, human environmental impact, geographic influences. ARD Committee placement.

name: Functional Social Studies I, World Geography
subject: Social Studies
description: Functional skills focusing on career exploration and employability within a World Geography context. ARD Committee placement.

name: Human Geography AP
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level: Study of patterns/processes shaping human understanding, use, alteration of Earth's surface using spatial concepts/human-environment interaction. Substitutes for WGEO.

name: Human Geography (TAG AP)
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level for TAG students: Study of patterns/processes shaping human use of Earth. Substitutes for WGEO.

name: World History Studies
subject: Social Studies
description: Overview of the history of humankind, analyzing important events/issues from earliest times to present.

name: World History Studies (Advanced)
subject: Social Studies
description: Advanced overview of the history of humankind.

name: World History Studies (TAG Advanced)
subject: Social Studies
description: Advanced overview for TAG students of the history of humankind.

name: World History Studies AP
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level: Develops understanding of the evolution of global processes and interaction with different human societies.

name: World History Studies (TAG AP)
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level for TAG students: Develops understanding of the evolution of global processes and interaction with different human societies.

name: World History Studies, Applied
subject: Social Studies
description: TEKS-based overview of humankind history, analyzing events/issues using critical thinking for applied students. ARD Committee placement.

name: Functional Social Studies II, World History
subject: Social Studies
description: Functional skills focusing on career exploration and employability within a World History context. ARD Committee placement.

name: European History AP
subject: Social Studies
description: Investigates intellectual, cultural, political, diplomatic, social, economic history of Europe from High Renaissance to present. Elective credit, cannot substitute WHIST.

name: U.S. History Studies since 1877
subject: Social Studies
description: Traces emergence/growth of the U.S. from Reconstruction to present.

name: U.S. History (Advanced)
subject: Social Studies
description: Advanced study of U.S. History from Reconstruction to present.

name: U.S. History (TAG Advanced)
subject: Social Studies
description: Advanced study for TAG students of U.S. History from Reconstruction to present.

name: U.S. History AP
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level: Traces US history from pre-Columbian societies to contemporary period. Emphasis on reading, arguments, data analysis.

name: U.S. History (TAG AP)
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level for TAG students: Traces US history from pre-Columbian societies to contemporary period.

name: U.S. History Studies (OnRamps US History Since 1865)
subject: Social Studies
description: OnRamps dual enrollment covering US History Since 1865. Paired with SpTopSS3ONR for full year/1.5 HS credits. Potential UT credit.

name: Special Topics in Social Studies III (OnRamps US History 1492-1865)
subject: Social Studies
description: OnRamps dual enrollment covering US History 1492-1865. Paired with USHISTONR. Potential UT credit.

name: United States History, Applied
subject: Social Studies
description: Basic understanding of U.S. History since Reconstruction (industrialization, urbanization, wars, Great Depression) for applied students. ARD Committee placement.

name: Functional Social Studies III, US History
subject: Social Studies
description: Functional skills focusing on career exploration and employability within a US History context. ARD Committee placement.

name: U.S. Government
subject: Social Studies
description: Focuses on principles/beliefs of US founding and structure, functions, powers of government (national, state, local).

name: U.S. Government and Politics AP
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level: Study of government established by US Constitution (federal system, separation of powers, major historical events). US History knowledge recommended.

name: U.S. Government and Politics (TAG AP)
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level for TAG students: Study of government established by US Constitution. US History knowledge recommended.

name: Government, Applied
subject: Social Studies
description: Surveys American political system, Constitution adoption, principles, parties, participation, branches for applied students. ARD Committee placement.

name: Government and Politics, Comparative AP
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level: Focuses on processes/outcomes of politics in various countries. Elective credit, does not substitute US Govt requirement.

name: Government and Politics, Comparative (TAG AP)
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level for TAG students: Focuses on politics in various countries. Elective credit, does not substitute US Govt requirement.

name: Economics w/ Emphasis on Free Enterprise
subject: Social Studies
description: Focuses on basic economic principles (production, consumption, distribution) in the US and comparison with other countries.

name: Personal Financial Literacy and Economics
subject: Social Studies
description: Emphasizes economic thinking for personal financial decision-making over a lifetime. Meets Economics graduation requirement.

name: Macroeconomics AP
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level: Focuses on principles applying to an economic system as a whole, including national/international decisions. Meets Economics graduation requirement.

name: Economics (Macroeconomics) (TAG AP)
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level for TAG students: Focuses on principles applying to an economic system as a whole. Meets Economics graduation requirement.

name: Microeconomics AP
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level: Focuses on principles applying to individual decision-makers (consumers/producers). Does not meet Econ grad req, counts as SS credit.

name: Economics (Microeconomics) (TAG AP)
subject: Social Studies
description: AP Level for TAG students: Focuses on principles applying to individual decision-makers. Does not meet Econ grad req, counts as SS credit.

name: Economics (OnRamps Intro to Microeconomics)
subject: Social Studies
description: OnRamps dual enrollment course using flipped/adaptive learning for Microeconomics concepts. Potential UT credit. Meets Economics graduation requirement.

name: Economics, Applied
subject: Social Studies
description: Basic understanding of America's economic system, free enterprise, government for applied students. ARD Committee placement.

name: Functional Social Studies IV, Government/Economics
subject: Social Studies
description: Functional skills focusing on career exploration and employability within Govt/Econ contexts. ARD Committee placement.

name: Advanced Ethnic Studies: African American Studies
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Develops understanding of African American historical roots, culture, social/economic/political interactions within US context. Analysis of ideas, values, beliefs.

name: African American Studies AP
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: AP Level: Develops understanding of African American history, culture, interactions. Analysis of ideas, values, beliefs, traditions. Emphasis on reading, arguments, data analysis.

name: Advanced Ethnic Studies: Mexican American Studies
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Develops understanding of Mexican American historical roots, culture, social/economic/political interactions within US context. Analysis of ideas, values, beliefs.

name: Hebrew Scriptures / Old Testament and New Testament
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Focuses on content, history, literary style/structure of Hebrew Scriptures/New Testament. Maintains religious neutrality.

name: Personal Financial Literacy
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Basic personal finance: earning, spending, saving, investing, credit, insurance, protecting assets, financing post-secondary ed. Cannot also get credit for PFLECO.

name: Philosophy (Special Topics)
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Explores Western ideas (Ancient Greek to 20th C Existentialists) shaping culture, plus parallels with Asian/Middle Eastern philosophies.

name: Psychology
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Introduction to psychology: history, individual/personality development, emotion, motivation, learning, dysfunctional behavior.

name: Psychology AP
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: AP Level: Systematic study of behavior/mental processes (humans/animals). Learn terminology, facts, principles, theories of major subfields.

name: Psychology, Investigations in (Advanced)
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Advanced course introducing scientific method in behavioral sciences: learning theory, sensation/perception, social psych, descriptive stats. Deeper dive into areas of interest.

name: Sociology
subject: Social Studies Elective
description: Scientific study of human behavior, social groups, society. Uses case studies, current events, research to study culture, research methods, social structure/stratification, socialization, deviance, social movements.
